page.title: 04ATTITUDES IN SYDMONTON
page.content:
THE FARM MANAGER AT FIELD HOUSE FARM RESENTS THE FACT THAT MANY LOCAL HORSERIDERS CAUSE DAMAGE TO CROPS BY RIDING ALONG PUBLIC FOOTPATHS INSTEAD OF STICKING TO BRIDLE PATHS. HE ALSO FEELS THAT LOCAL RAMBLERS DO NOT COOPERATE SUFFICIENTLY WITH FARMERS WHEN THE LATTER REQUEST TO ALTER THE ROUTE OF FOOTPATHS.
AT SYDMONTON THERE IS A FEELING OF REGRET THAT THE CHURCH ON SYDMONTON COURT ESTATE, WHICH LOCAL PEOPLE USED TO ATTEND, NO LONGER EXISTS BECAUSE IT WAS DE-CONSECRATED WHEN THE ESTATE WAS SOLD TO THE PRESENT OWNER.
